DOC.brief_summary: Evaluation pulmonary edema key factor monitor guidance therapy acute respiratory distress syndrome ( ARDS ) patient . To date , method available bedside estimate physiologic correlate pulmonary edema , extravascular lung water ( EVLW ) , often unreliable require invasive measurement . The purpose study develop novel approach reliably assess extravascular lung water electrical impedance tomography ( EIT ) .
DOC.brief_title: Electrical Impedance Tomography Quantification Pulmonary Edema Acute Respiratory Distress Syndrome Patients
DOC.criteria: Patients include study follow criterion meet : 1 . Males females > 18 year old < 85 year old ( non−pregnant , non−lactating female ) . 2 . Patients fulfil Berlin diagnostic criterion ARDS 3 . Signed write informed consent obtain 4 . Patients monitor system PulseInduced Contour Cardiac Output ( PiCCO ) 1 . Females pregnant lactating . 2 . Patients contraindication EIT ( Skin abrasion wound chest area.Patients pacemaker pace EKG rhythms.Thoracic deformity . Severe subcutaneous emphysema ) 3 . Patients < 18 year old > 85 year old 4 . Patients Without monitor system PulseInduced Contour Cardiac Output ( PiCCO ) 5 .
